chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: AbsRing
V: CompleteNormedModule K

Goal:
forall P : V -> Prop, (exists ! x : V, P x) -> P (iota P)

Premises:
Notation CompleteNormedModule := CompleteNormedModule.type
iota = fun (T : CompleteSpace) (P : T -> Prop) => lim (fun A : T -> Prop => forall x : T, P x -> A x) : forall T : CompleteSpace, (T -> Prop) -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope]
uniqueness_dec : forall P : R -> Prop, (exists ! x : R, P x) -> {x : R | P x}
close_iota : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x <-> Q x) -> close (iota P) (iota Q) where ?T : [K : AbsRing V : CompleteNormedModule K |- CompleteSpace]
iota_correct_weak : forall P : ?T -> Prop, (forall x y : ?T, P x -> P y -> close x y) -> forall x : ?T, P x -> close (iota P) x where ?T : [K : AbsRing V : CompleteNormedModule K |- CompleteSpace]
iota_unique : forall (P : V -> Prop) (x : V), (forall y : V, P y -> y = x) -> P x -> iota P = x
Build_ProperFilter : forall (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop), (forall P : T -> Prop, F P -> exists x : T, P x) -> Filter F -> ProperFilter F
Build_Filter : forall (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop), F (fun _ : T => True) -> (forall P Q : T -> Prop, F P -> F Q -> F (fun x : T => P x /\ Q x)) -> (forall P Q : T -> Prop, (forall x : T, P x -> Q x) -> F P -> F Q) -> Filter F
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
filter_imp : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x -> Q x) -> ?F P -> ?F Q where ?T : [K : AbsRing V : CompleteNormedModule K |- Type] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : CompleteNormedModule K |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [K : AbsRing V : CompleteNormedModule K |- Filter ?F]
filter_and : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, ?F P -> ?F Q -> ?F (fun x : ?T => P x /\ Q x) where ?T : [K : AbsRing V : CompleteNormedModule K |- Type] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : CompleteNormedModule K |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [K : AbsRing V : CompleteNormedModule K |- Filter ?F]
Eqdep_dec.K_dec_on : forall (A : Type) (x : A), (forall y : A, x = y \/ x <> y) -> forall P : x = x -> Prop, P eq_refl -> forall p : x = x, P p
Record Filter (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) : Prop := Build_Filter { filter_true : F (fun _ : T => True); filter_and : forall P Q : T -> Prop, F P -> F Q -> F (fun x : T => P x /\ Q x); filter_imp : forall P Q : T -> Prop, (forall x : T, P x -> Q x) -> F P -> F Q } For Filter: Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted For Filter: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope] For Build_Filter: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ function_scope function_scope]
is_filter_lim = fun (T : UniformSpace) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (x : T) => forall P : T -> Prop, locally x P -> F P : forall T : UniformSpace, ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> T -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope _]
filter_le = fun (T : Type) (F G : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) => forall P : T -> Prop, G P -> F P : forall T : Type, ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope]
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
Eqdep_dec.inj_right_pair_on : forall (A : Type) (x : A), (forall y : A, x = y \/ x <> y) -> forall (P : A -> Prop) (y y' : P x), ex_intro P x y = ex_intro P x y' -> y = y'
Eqdep_dec.inj_right_pair : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, x = y \/ x <> y) -> forall (x : A) (P : A -> Prop) (y y' : P x), ex_intro P x y = ex_intro P x y' -> y = y'
Record ProperFilter (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) : Prop := Build_ProperFilter { filter_ex : forall P : T -> Prop, F P -> exists x : T, P x; filter_filter : Filter F } For ProperFilter: Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted For ProperFilter: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope] For Build_ProperFilter: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope _]
Decidable.decidable = fun P : Prop => P \/ ~ P : Prop -> Prop Argument scope is [type_scope]
Filter_prod : forall (F : (?T -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (?U -> Prop) -> Prop) (P : ?T * ?U -> Prop) (Q : ?T -> Prop) (R : ?U -> Prop), F Q -> G R -> (forall (x : ?T) (y : ?U), Q x -> R y -> P (x, y)) -> filter_prod F G P where ?T : [K : AbsRing V : CompleteNormedModule K |- Type] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : CompleteNormedModule K |- Type]
locally_norm = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (x : V) (P : V -> Prop) => exists eps : posreal, forall y : V, ball_norm x eps y -> P y : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), V -> (V -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ _ function_scope]
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} For sig: Argument A is implicit For exist: Argument A is implicit For sig: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For exist: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ _]
filter_prod_proper = fun (T1 T2 : Type) (F : (T1 -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (T2 -> Prop) -> Prop) (FF : ProperFilter F) (FG : ProperFilter G) => {| filter_ex := fun (P : T1 * T2 -> Prop) (H : filter_prod F G P) => match H with | @Filter_prod _ _ _ _ _ Q1 Q2 H1 H2 HP => (fun _evar_0_ : forall (x : T1) (p : (fun x0 : T1 => Q1 x0) x), (fun _ : exists x0 : T1, Q1 x0 => exists x0 : T1 * T2, P x0) (ex_intro (fun x0 : T1 => Q1 x0) x p) => match filter_ex Q1 H1 as e return ((fun _ : exists x : T1, Q1 x => exists x : T1 * T2, P x) e)...
NormedModule.Mixin : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModuleAux K) (norm : V -> R) (norm_factor : R), (forall x y : V, norm (plus x y) <= norm x + norm y) -> (forall (l : K) (x : V), norm (scal l x) <= abs l * norm x) -> (forall (x y : V) (eps : R), norm (minus y x) < eps -> ball x eps y) -> (forall (x y : V) (eps : posreal), ball x eps y -> norm (minus y x) < norm_factor * eps) -> (forall x : V, norm x = 0 -> x = zero) -> NormedModule.mixin_of K V
locally = fun (T : UniformSpace) (x : T) (P : T -> Prop) => exists eps : posreal, forall y : T, ball x eps y -> P y : forall T : UniformSpace, T -> (T -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope]
Inductive filter_prod (T U : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (U -> Prop) -> Prop) (P : T * U -> Prop) : Prop := Filter_prod : forall (Q : T -> Prop) (R : U -> Prop), F Q -> G R -> (forall (x : T) (y : U), Q x -> R y -> P (x, y)) -> filter_prod F G P For filter_prod: Arguments T, U are implicit and maximally inserted For Filter_prod: Arguments T, U are implicit and maximally inserted For filter_prod: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope] For Filter_prod: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope _ _ function_scope]
complete_cauchy : forall F : (?T -> Prop) -> Prop, ProperFilter F -> cauchy F -> forall eps : posreal, F (ball (lim F) eps) where ?T : [K : AbsRing V : CompleteNormedModule K |- CompleteSpace]
Decidable.dec_functional_relation : forall (X Y : Type) (A : X -> Y -> Prop), (forall y y' : Y, Decidable.decidable (y = y')) -> (forall x : X, exists ! y : Y, A x y) -> forall (x : X) (y : Y), Decidable.decidable (A x y)
Record mixin_of (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModuleAux K) : Type := Mixin { norm : V -> R; norm_factor : R; ax1 : forall x y : V, norm (plus x y) <= norm x + norm y; ax2 : forall (l : K) (x : V), norm (scal l x) <= abs l * norm x; ax3 : forall (x y : V) (eps : R), norm (minus y x) < eps -> ball x eps y; ax4 : forall (x y : V) (eps : posreal), ball x eps y -> norm (minus y x) < norm_factor * eps; ax5 : forall x : V, norm x = 0 -> x = zero } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope R_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
filtermapi = fun (T U : Type) (f : T -> U -> Prop) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (P : U -> Prop) => F (fun x : T => exists y : U, f x y /\ P y) : forall T U : Type, (T -> U -> Prop) -> ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> (U -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments T, U are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
close_lim : forall F1 F2 : (?T -> Prop) -> Prop, filter_le F1 F2 -> filter_le F2 F1 -> close (lim F1) (lim F2) where ?T : [K : AbsRing V : CompleteNormedModule K |- CompleteSpace]
